did.unittitle: Charles Willson Peale Belfield farm accounts,1816-[1822]
did.abstract: This volume contains accounts of expenses and income of his Belfield farm.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Charles Coleman Sellers and accessioned, 1945 (1945 85096).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This collection is also available on microfilm (Film 240). The papers of C. W. Peale and his family have been reproduced almost in their entirety in microfiche form (Lillian B. Miller, ed. "Collected papers of Charles Willson Peale and his family." Kraus Microfilm, 1980).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The main body of the Peale Collection is described briefly in American Philosophical Society "Year Book" 1945:74-77.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: For an account of Peale's country place, see Jessie J. Poesch, "Mr. Peale's Farm Persevere," American Philosophical Society Proceedings 100(1956):545-556.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Willson Peale was an artist and naturalist. In 1810 he "retired" from the management of his museum in Philadelphia and bought a farm located near Germantown, Pennsylvania.

odd.head: Early American History Not
odd.p: This volume records various accounts from Charles Willson Peale’s Belfield farm. It complements the daybook volumes (B P31.4-5) from Charles Willson Peale’s farm near Germantown. This volume is mostly blank, but its first few pages contain financial information on the farm’s expenses for 1816-1817.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.
